channel.title: Run Command as Another User - Perfect Dark Mode
channel.description: To invoke a login shell using sudo just use -i. When command is not specified you’ll get a login shell prompt, otherwise you’ll get the output of your command. Example (login shell): sudo -iExample (with a specified user): sudo -i -u userExample (with a command): sudo -i -u user whoamiExample (print user’s $HOME): sudo -i -u user echo \$HOMENote: The backslash character ensures that the dollar sign reaches the target user’s shell and is not interpreted in the calling user’s shell.
